headline: Shopping Platform for Concerts
description:

headline: WYSIWYG Editor
description:
The development journey for this was extremly satisfying, challinging and interesting.

It uses a basic contenteditable html element and under the hood I'm using NextJS (React) and Meta's new library Lexical.
I'm using it since it released on the canary alpha channel with no documentation. So I always (still do) look through the source code to understand how to utilize the library.

The image is streamed to the backend, the backend streams the chunks it receives immediatetely to the S3 Storage.
Thanks to that this is really efficiently solved, resulting in a much lower RAM utilization on the BE.

headline: Mail Transfer Monitoring Distributed System
description:
As part of a university assignment, I designed a robust multi-threaded-system featuring Mail Servers, Transfer Servers, and a Monitoring Server components using Java Sockets.

I implemented custom protocols, DMTP (Data Mail Transfer Protocol) and DMAP (Data Mail Access Protocol), to suit the project's requirements.

For efficiency considerations, I chose UDP for communication with the Monitoring Server and TCP for DMAP/DMTP.
This decision reflects a deliberate effort to optimize performance and reliability within the system while adhering to the project's specifications.

images.description: The architecture of the system
Two Mail Servers, one Transfer Server and one Client communicating with each other.

headline: Animal Ownership Platform
description:
A platform that manages horses of owners. Further you can edit information and see the ancestry of each horse.

The family tree was interesting to implement. Utilizing a recursive SQL Query and a recursive approach to render components efficiently, the endresult is quite satisfying.

 Developed it with Spring Boot BE and Angular FE.
